Description/Alt Text: This one is from the Refuge group. This is the only mildly positive drawing. She’s drawn a cute little girl and written, “you are very interesting.” She’s visualized her math person as a girl made of shapes. You can see triangles and other elements of math, very mildly.

She starts by writing an acronym for math: “Mental Attack to Hyper students.” Then she says, “I’m not gonna let you go away from me.” Her math human has shapes built into the body, (a triangle for a nose, pencils for hands, and squares for eyes), so you can see mathematical forms in how she’s drawn the person. Next to it, she’s written, “you actually look great and cute,” and she’s named the character Maths Man.

This math person is called Itachi. At the top, she’s written, “this is Itachi.” The math person is made up of shapes: a triangular cone for a hat, a face drawn with this emoji :-|, circles for feet, and rectangles for the rest of the body. You can see shapes being used to represent the math person.

The conversation is very aggressive. It says, “Why the hell did you find math, Itachi?” Then, “Is it too much that you found math? No one likes math, Itachi.” She also asks, “Is your home built with numbers, Itachi?” At the end, she writes, “My mood just goes off because of you, Itachi, because of this math.”
Questions: Why the hell did you find math? | Is your home built with numbers?

Description/Alt Text:
This one is written by a volunteer, a second-year college student. She writes, “Dear Math, I’ve despised you all my school life. However, having lived the next couple of years without you in my syllabus, I’ve come to miss you. I appreciate your presence and will try to understand you more. Geometry, physics, accounts, you poke your nose everywhere. Do that a little less, nosy neighbor.” She also adds, “I hope the world gets to explore you throughout and never forget any concept we learned.", and ends with  "I felt dumb because of you!”

Her math person looks a bit like a Joker character, with a hat made of a triangle, cube, and sphere. The character is saying, “Is math a joke to you?!”

This math person is named Killer. It has Xs for eyes, an equal sign for a mouth, 3s for ears, a conical hat, and a body made of rectangles. The second half of the image has huge letters: “WHY did you come into this world?” The tone is very aggressive and direct.
form: literal, made of shapes, made of numbers
Questions: WHY did you come into this world?

Description/Alt Text:
This math creature is called Torture Killer. It has a 1 for a nose. Parts of the body are colored green: the cap, the hands, a belt, and the shoes. There’s “8288” written on the shirt.

Along with the drawing, she’s written a letter to Maths. It says: “Dear Maths, Hello. Who created you? Because of you, I got scolding from when I was 6 years old, means from 1st standard to 8th standard. Get out of this world. Don’t think that after this people die next generation. I will come next generation also. Don’t ever come back, The next generation’s children will suffer. Yours sincerely, Park Eren.”
emotion: anger, rage, aggressive, direct, threatening, humiliation, scolded

Description/Alt Text:
This math person is called Numb, because numbers make her feel numb. She’s used 1s for the hair, squares with dots inside for the eyes, and a triangle for the nose. Numb’s shirt is covered in numbers: 1 to 16 across the shirt, 17 and 18 as the collar, and the pants filled with numbers—19 to 33 on one leg and 34 to 50 on the other.

She’s also drawn herself next to Numb and named herself Jasmine. Above Jasmine’s head are multiplication tables, and her face looks sad and confused

Jasmine is asking Numb a series of questions: “Who are you? Why are you created? Why did they keep your name as Maths? In the world, many students hate you. Do you have feelings? Do you cry? You are a very difficult subject for many students. I’m going mad when I learn.”
form: metaphorical, detailed, made of numbers, made of shapes, punny
Questions: Who are you?, Why are you created? | Why did they keep your name as Maths? | In the world, many students hate you. Do you have feelings? Do you cry?

Description/Alt Text:
This math person is named Mary Chacko, which is the student’s math teacher. The face is a clock, and the rest of the body is made of numbers. The torso uses numbers 1 to 5. One arm is numbered 5 to 9, the other arm 6 to 10. One leg is numbered 11 to 14, and the other leg repeats 2, 3, and 4. She’s also labeled the face, hand, and leg.

On the side, there’s only one question addressed to her math creature: “Who is your father?”
form: made of shapes, made of numbers

Description/Alt Text:
This math creature is named Chiyaan. The face is a square. The eyes are made of sixes, the eyebrows are lines, and an X is used for the mouth. The torso is a single line, with eights for arms and nines for legs, giving it a stick-figure form.

This one has only one question: “Why are you created?”
form: made of numbers, stick figure, made of shapes

Description/Alt Text:
This one is written by a volunteer in her second year of college, B.Com. The math person is named Mr. Math (RD Sharma). The character wears a hat. The face is a smiling cube, the torso is a cone, and the lower body is an inverted cone. It’s holding something that looks like a cookie. The hands are lines, and the legs and feet are rectangles.

It says, “I’m smiling because tears of kids make me happy.”

Asif imagines math as Chota Bheem. He’s drawn Chota Bheem holding a bag of laddus, which is Chota Bheem’s signature thing. There’s also something on the side that looks like a launcher, which Asif seems to imagine as a way to launch the laddus at his students.

Asif has written a note next to the drawing that says, “Bheem is putting glass because he’s math’s teacher.” Through this, Asif is showing that the way he has added a math teacher persona to Chota Bheem is by giving him glasses.
The next math creature is called Joker. There is a clown who is juggling balls, or objects that look like balls. The balls have motion trails behind them, showing the movement of juggling.

This child has drawn a math tree. In the leaves of the tree, there are symbols like plus signs, multiplication signs, division signs, minus signs, and a 1. These symbols are arranged to form a triangular pattern that sits within the branches.

The top row has six plus signs, with the last one rotated into a multiplication sign. Below that are three multiplication signs, then three minus signs, then three division signs, and finally a 1 at the bottom.

The tree trunk has a smiling face and two separate hands with leaves, making it look like a stick-figure-style humanoid tree.

The next child has drawn a math apple. The apple has two square eyes with dots in the middle and the word “math” written below them. Around the apple, there are multiplication signs on the left and right, and division signs near the top, close to the stem. At the base of the apple, there is some negative space, and there are plus and minus signs there, with the words “area” and “perimeter” written just below them.

The apple has a smiling mouth, and its teeth are showing. Below the drawing, the child has written "He is boy, he is a smart person and the math is taking a class. and I gone listen and the apple math is crying because I ate math apple half. It is so sad and the student is laughing" So the negative space at the base of the apple represents the half that has been eaten.

Harshita’s math tree. It starts off like a normal tree, with a trunk, two main branches, and leaves surrounding the branches. Instead of fruits, the leaves contain symbols and numbers: a couple of plus signs, numbers like 50, 100, 1, 2, and 25, along with division signs. One of the division signs is slightly rotated, looking like a modulus sign, which is likely a coincidence.

On the trunk of the tree, there is an evil smiling face. The expression looks evil because of the eyebrows and the shape of the mouth. Below the leaves, there are two additional branches that act like hands reaching outward, almost as if the tree is coming to get you.
The next student has drawn a tree. On the side, there is a girl wearing her school uniform. An arrow points to text that says she is crying because she doesn’t know ABCD.

This math creature is a sun that's teaching math. The sun is wearing glasses and holding a sheet with a heading, "1 x 23x" and a few math symbols. In the other hand, it is holding a pen. The sun is smiling and sweating, likely because it is very hot. It is perfectly circular and has legs and feet. Behind the sun is a blackboard with different math equations, including long division, large numbers being subtracted, 7/6, 12/12, and a BODMAS equation.

This child's math creature looks like a cat, made entirely of mathematical shapes. The face is a circle, the ears are triangles, the eyes are circles, the nose is a triangle, and the mouth is an oval. The torso and arms are rectangles, the palms are triangles with cylinders coming out, and the legs are straight lines with a curve at the end. It is a cat-like figure made with shapes.

This child's math creature is called Ravi. He has a cap shaped like a whistle. The face is a circle, and the figure is made with a combination of shapes and stick-figure elements. An arrow pointing to the right says "addition," and an arrow pointing to the left says "subtraction." The creature has a torso, pants, shoes, and hands. On the side, there is text in quotes: "he like black, C-L-O-C-E-R and B-U-L-E."

This math creature looks robot-like. It has a circular face with two antennae and is smiling. The torso is a square, the arms are rectangles with spheres for hands, and the legs and feet are rectangles. The creature is named Rocky, and the text says "it is look like boy and smart".

This math creature has a very big circular face with Xs for eyes and a slightly evil-looking, curved smile. It is wearing a cap, a top, and pants. The arms are lifted up towards the right, with an arrow labeled "scary." The text says "It is a boy. This boy is very scary"

This math creature looks like a robot with two antennae and an oval-ish face with a smiling mouth. It has a square torso with circles for buttons, rectangular limbs, rounded arms, and rectangular feet. The text says, "It look like boy and smart."

This math creature looks like a ghost. The head and limbs resemble the top half of a star, but instead of completing into a star, it has three lines as legs. It is holding a scythe, like a grim reaper. Behind it are smaller versions of the creature, which look like bodyguards, an army, or helpers. The text at the side says, "My name is Yamraj." (Yamraj is the god of death in Hindu culture.)

This math creature is called King. It has a square head with Xs for eyes, a division sign for a nose, and a curved mouth like a moon filled with lines to show teeth. The torso is a rectangle with squares containing plus signs as buttons, and a square pocket or pocket square with lines on the left side. The limbs are rectangles with rounded ends. The text reads, "This is a boy. He look very smart. Her name is King. King is a mathmatics."
